metadata.name: Cloudflared Tunnels Related DNS Requests
metadata.comment: Detects DNS requests to Cloudflared tunnels domains. Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM dns_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(query.hostname), lower('.v2.argotunnel.com')) OR endswith(lower(query.hostname), lower('protocol-v2.argotunnel.com')) OR endswith(lower(query.hostname), lower('trycloudflare.com')) OR endswith(lower(query.hostname), lower('update.argotunnel.com'))))

output.summary: Detects DNS requests to Cloudflared tunnels domains. Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate use of cloudflare tunnels will also trigger this. References: https://www.guidepointsecurity.com/blog/tunnel-vision-cloudflared-abused-in-the-wild/, Internal Research
